Description: Fragment from body of large pottery bowl. Interior glazed, with white-red-white bands, almost effaced. Outside, white slip, part of a frieze of goats grazing to right (part of two preserved), rosettes and triangle in the field; above and below, key maeander friezes between bands with added red band lined in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 219, no. 62)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 106, no. 316.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.109)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4659 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
